tool.name: tool_4

param.name: TARGET_PT_X
param.dialogReference:
Target X coordinate

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

The x-coordinate of the target point in world coordinates [map units]

param.name: TARGET_PT_Y
param.dialogReference:
Target Y coordinate

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

The y-coordinate of the target point in world coordinates [map units]

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Deterministic 8

[1] Deterministic Infinity

[2] Multiple Flow Direction

[3] Multiple Triangular Flow Directon

[4] Multiple Maximum Downslope Gradient Based Flow Directon

Default: 2

param.name: CONVERGE
param.dialogReference:
Convergence

Floating point

Minimum: 0.001000

Default: 1.100000

Convergence factor for Multiple Flow Direction algorithm

param.name: MFD_CONTOUR
param.dialogReference:
Contour Length

Boolean

Default: 0

Include (pseudo) contour length as additional weighting factor in multiple flow direction routing, reduces flow to diagonal neighbour cells by a factor of 0.71 (s. Quinn et al. 1991 for details).

tool.summary:
This tool allows you to specify target cells, for which the upslope contributing area shall be identified. The result will give for each cell the percentage of its flow that reaches the target cell(s). _______
This version uses all valid cells (not 'no data' values) of a given target grid to determine the contributing area. In case no target grid is provided as input, the specified x/y coordinates are used as target point.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
